TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AesManaged extends System.Security.Cryptography.Aes
Public NotInheritable Class AesManaged Inherits Aes
public ref class AesManaged sealed : System::Security::Cryptography::Aes

Docs.summary: Provides a managed implementation of the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) symmetric algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The AES algorithm is essentially the Rijndael symmetric algorithm with a fixed block size and iteration count. This class functions the same way as the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RijndaelManaged> class but limits blocks to 128 bits and does not allow feedback modes.
> [!NOTE] > If the Windows security policy setting for Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant algorithms is enabled, using this algorithm throws a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to encrypt and decrypt sample data using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AesManaged> class.
[!code-csharp[AesManaged#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/aesmanaged/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[AesManaged#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/aesmanaged/vb/program.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of bits to use as feedback.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The maximum feedback size is 128 bits.
> [!NOTE] > Because this algorithm does not support feedback modes, using this property is discouraged.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the mode for operation of the symmetric algorithm.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the block cipher mode to use for encryption. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.CFB> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode.OFB> modes are not supported.
